title: After Defeating The Campaign, Is There Anything Else Left To Do?
body: Are there like 1 v 1s you can do against other players?

replies.body: We tried to make the ruleset as lightweight and modular as possible, so as others have mentioned you'll definitely be able to create your own scenarios. There's also some extra content you unlock upon beating the game... and honestly, I must have played each mission literally dozens and dozens of times and I _still_ enjoy going back to play them every chance I get.

TFW when I get two responses from Rito in a day.

{{sticker:zombie-nunu-hearts}}
What would your face be if you got three?
OH MY GERD FOUR RRREEEROOOOTTTT PIIIIOOOSTS ON MY THREEEEED
I'd imagine the only thing left to do is create your own missions. Maybe there'll be more that people come up with.
I'm looking forward to playing missions that players come up with, but there is definitely some replayability to each of the missions, even once you've made your way to the end.

maybe you will be able to start sharing missions you created. or riot will come up with new missions.
just a thought
I would assume being a board game that each mission would be replayable on it's own if it is a fun game. Plus I heard each mission has a normal and hard setting.

Expansions and Player Mods are also hugely popular in Boardgaming. I can't wait to see what the players come up with. And I very much hope that this game is successful enough to warrant Expansions, and/or more Riot boardgames. {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-rainbows}}

Board games with this structure typically have a ton of community support. So I would imagine the board game community will come out with a ton of additional scenarios/missions that are freely available on [board game geek](https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/209010/mechs-vs-minions).

If the game takes off (especially within the board game community), I imagine it will evolve similar to[ Robinson Crusoe](https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/121921/robinson-crusoe-adventures-cursed-island) - where the game lends itself to creating new stories to support the additional missions. Though, it will probably take some time before good additional missions come out, especially with as hard as this game will be to get initially.

After beating the campaign, there is a vague something you unlock that makes it worth replaying. 

Don't know the specifics because people are avoiding spoilers.
As far as I can tell it's a glorified D&D. Do what you'd do with that and either go find more prefab adventures or make your own.
